name: grogger
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a wooden device that when turned round and round produces a noise like a series of knocks, traditionally used during the Jewish festival of Purim: She drowned out the sound of his voice by twirling her grogger. Grogger is Yiddish for rattle. Compare
rattle
Floortje/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesGroggers, or noisemakers, are used in the synagogue during the reading of Megillat Esther on Purim, whenever the name of the wicked "Haman" is mentioned.We make so much noise with groggers that nobody can hear that hated name.
